definition: lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: The Johnsons have come up in the world.
sentences.chinese: 約翰一家已飛黃騰達起來了。

sentences.english: Too many fellows think they can push themselves forward by patting themselves on the back.
sentences.chinese: 很多人以爲自吹自捧，就可以飛黃騰達。

sentences.english: In brief, Lydgate was what is called a successful man.
sentences.chinese: 總之，利德蓋特是我們所說的飛黃騰達的人。

sentences.english: Also said that after his the apprentice, will return LuoFeng.
sentences.chinese: 還說以後自己飛黃騰達了，會報答羅豐。

definition: to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
lit. no one picks up lost articles in the street (idiom)/fig. honesty prevails throughout society
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
